intro: Wendtia gracilis var. typica, commonly known as the slender wendtia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Acanthaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically produces clusters of bright red or orange flowers that bloom during the warmer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Wendtia gracilis var. typica is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
